thread.title: Zbrush like Blender is now downloadable! With Tutorial!

post.author: ajm113
post.body:
I found this on the internet and thought you monster designers would love this!

Download:
http://www.blenderbuilds.com/2006/12/07 ... er-wu-man/

Tutorial:
http://www.becausewecan.org/node/258

This is really cool! Good thing im a Blender user! It seems someone always makes a very good use out of Blender's open source code.

post.author: Goofos
post.body:
The first 2.43 release candidate is now available:
http://www.blender3d.org/cms/Changes_si ... 771.0.html

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
has anyone in here tested the latest builds?

I am interested in the sculpt modeling.

post.author: kat
post.body:
Not yet, no. I toyed with Sharp Construct for a while but stopped becasue to do the detailing that we need you needed a pretty powerful PC or your have to change your workflow and break models down into smaller sections.

Definately interesed in seeing how 'sculpty' has been incorporated into Blender though.

Some shots I just found on the new tool
http://mediawiki.blender.org/index.php/ ... ting_Tools

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body: understood, and I too saw those sample images, very impressive considering their apparently sculpted in blender. it would also be interesting to see the spec of the pc's those models needed to get results like that.

post.author: Goofos
post.body: I played a bit with some new features and i really dont have a highend sys (XP 3200+, 512 MB Ram and GF6600GT). Sculptmode works good and fast in a acceptable high multires mesh level. The only sad thing was blender simply hang if i add a too high multires level (and some other crashes but still stable for a release candidate :>) so it was impossible to add such superdetails like pores. But i used a full body + head mesh and i think splitting the head from the body should work.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
understood and still sounds cool goofos

do you have any images you can show us of your test done with the sculpt mode?

post.author: Goofos
post.body: It dont look very interesting

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body: goofos, I wouldn't mind if it was just a cube with some displaced verts, but I can wait until you have some other tests your more happy to show us
